summary: A Federal Bureau of Prisons (BOP) legal hold notice sent to a record custodian regarding the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein. The notice instructs the recipient to preserve all records and electronically stored information related to Epstein's death, which occurred on August 10, 2019, and is described as an apparent suicide. The document is marked as privileged and confidential.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate whose death is the subject of the legal hold notice. He was found unresponsive in his cell on August 10, 2019, in an apparent suicide.

persons.name: Joseph N Columbo
persons.context: Named in the subject line and filename of the legal hold notice, indicating he is likely the intended recipient and a custodian of records for the BOP.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein found dead in cell
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at around 6:30 am, in conjunction with an apparent suicide. He was later pronounced dead at a local hospital.

events.title: Deadline for Custodian Document Search Checklist
events.description: The recipient of the legal hold notice is required to complete and return a Custodian Document Search Checklist by this date.

locations: Federal Bureau of Prisons, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell on August 10, 2019, at around 6:30 am, in an apparent suicide.
The Federal Bureau of Prisons issued a legal hold notice to preserve all records and electronically stored information related to Epstein's death, anticipating a lawsuit.
The notice is marked as privileged and confidential and instructs the recipient not to forward or share it.
The notice specifies that relevant information includes emails, Word documents, TRUSCOPE entries, videos, and SEMR records pertaining to inmate Epstein.
